text: [Music]
people that have worked in co-located
spaces for so long their entire lives
have been dictated by you must commute
in at this time and you must commute out
at this time and you can only consider
what your life could look like between
this hour in this hour and overtime you
sort of become numb to what would be
possible if that were not true so people
end up minimizing their lives and they
look back and they think what did that
do the last 10 years
not a whole lot because you didn't have
a lot of time outside of the commute and
the rigid hours that you worked so for a
lot of people their imagination has been
dulled just because as self-preservation
takes over you just kind of forget how
to use it you don't really think about
the fact that you're wasting weeks of
your life every year in a vehicle
commuting to a job that could probably
be done from anywhere so the first step
is unlocking your imagination and this
goes into the nonlinear work day what
could a day look like if you could get
up early work a few hours but then break
and go do something in the middle of the
day and then come back and work later
into the evening for example
